website_summaries.verdict: This custom towing mirror ensures an ideal fit and no annoying vibration.
pros: Conveniently slides over an existing mirror with wedge-lock security
Boasts a sleek design to complement an existing mirror perfectly
Easy to install, and no tools are required for installation
Durable ABS plastic construction ensures the mirror is built to last
cons: May fall off of a mount after extended use

customer_reviews.title: like
customer_reviews.text: There's actually a screw knob to attach so from other side you will see the screw knob ( so it doesn't look exactly like your stock mirror ) but it's not a big deal. Easy to put on , take off. Did the job although I found I would have appreciated a larger mirror surface area. Wayyyyy cheaper than stock towing mirrors option from Ford and I don't have to deal with oversized mirrors when not towing cuz I can simply remove these when not in use! Would go this route again.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: it can take several attempts to find that happy medium for highway use and backing
customer_reviews.text: After using these mirrors for almost two years, they perform well overall. Obviously, being manually adjusted, it can take several attempts to find that happy medium for highway use and backing. The driver side mirror didn't tighten very well with the provided shim and thumb screw. Consequently, that one blew off on the highway, so it had to be replaced. The mirror itself seems to be of good quality and remains to be clear, free of any flaws with the materials. I use mine towing a 5th wheel camper, and do believe these are the best extension mirrors you can find, just really pay attention to any slightly loose fitting. It should be snug when it's right.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap add-on mirror I have used
customer_reviews.text: These worked great on my 2014 F150 XLT for pulling a 27' travel trailer. These fit over the out side of the OEM mirrors. There is a wedge the holds them on with out shacking or marring the OEM mirror. The extra mirror was too stiff when it was unpacked so I used silicone spray on the inside where the mirror pivots. I worked it in before putting them on piror to their second use. Without the silicone it seemed the mirrors would break when adjusting them. I was looking at the hundred dollar plus tow mirrors, but for me these will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: CobraJ

customer_reviews.title: Made for F150 but was able to make it work on my Expedition.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my 2008 Ford Expedition even though they are not designed for it. Nobody makes a slip-on mirror for the Expedition and for some stupid reason Ford had to use different mirrors on Expeditions even though it's the same chassis as F150s. While they do not technically fit properly they will slip over the top but not quite over the bottom. In my case I just put two self-tapping screws into the back of the mirror to attach it to the factory mirror and it holds great and looks fine. Doesn't vibrate like the "universal" ones do so it's actually useful.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: They work ok
customer_reviews.text: I used them for about a year or two before I finally bought the factory style towing mirrors for my truck. I got tired of having to manually adjust them based on the trailer i was towing. They work well for the price. I put the small convex mirrors on them to try to help with visibility but that didn't really help all that much. If you frequently tow different trailers you will have to adjust these every time which gets tedious. It goes faster with a second person. I would just save your money and buy the true factory style tow mirrors which have much better visibility and are powered.
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 2006 F-150
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to see these on Amazon and ordered them right away. They came in a day which was nice. The downside is the fitment for a 2006 Ford F-150. Even though Amazon states it will fit the truck, they do not. I tried several times to get them to slide over the mirror and while the bottom fits, the top will not slide onto the mirror as designed. I included a pic showing how the top fits on the mirror and it is plain to see that these mirrors are not molded to fit the stock 2006 mirror. Overall, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SoehligTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: 2013 Ford F150 I tow a 2014 Keystone Bullet 27' in length and can see both sides of my trailer using these mirrors. Once installed they fit snug, limited vibration but for the price these mirrors do the job. Takes a few moments to get them adjusted, if you have a passenger it will save you a few minutes to get the mirrors dialed in. Easy to install, easy to remove and store in the RV. I have no regrets purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: bkipplen

customer_reviews.title: Sleek look and perfect function
customer_reviews.text: These are so much better than the velcro towing mirrors! They look sleek and look like they belong with the truck instead of an afterthought. These are worth the extra money. Easy to install and remove and these extend my viewing area while towing a travel trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Decent but lacking
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 2014 like it should. I wish they were a little wider as I cannot see cars behind me on the passenger side due to the awning supports on the camper. Installation is OK, could be better as the shims slide in, but you don't know if the thumb screw is on the right spot. If it isn't, you risk the mirror vibrating off. Decent price from Amazon warehouse has me keeping them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gehrke

customer_reviews.title: Super easy install and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, very easy install. Slip over and screw down tight. Not going anywhere and works like it's supposed to. Now I have a much wider view for my travel trailer and didn't have to buy new mirrors. I Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Staci

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive solution to something that is needed for campers
customer_reviews.text: These attach easily, but don't look for the directions to tell you everything you need to know. Be sure to push the little black piece in that the knob screws into. It must go into the correct hole or the mirror will slide off. (You will know what I am talking about when you have the mirrors in front of you.) This mirror allows you to keep your electric mirrors where they are and adjust the new mirror to where it is best located. It is handy to have a second person to adjust the passenger side mirror to the correct position.
customer_reviews.author: Lois M. Charlebois

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Best trailer add-on mirrors I have tried. After trying multiple add-on towing mirrors these finally make the grade. The others I tried left marks on my doors, vibrated so bad I couldn't see from them or just weren't clear enough to use. These mirrors are stable, clear and very easy to mount. They allow the use of the puddle lights and blinkers as well. Highly recommended if you're looking for towing mirrors!
customer_reviews.author: G. Reon

customer_reviews.title: F-150 / Wolf Creek Camper
customer_reviews.text: Really not much help w/ my F-150 and full size camper. Mirror is small and does not get out far enough with a full size camper. Would find a mirror that has further extension next time. Quality is good and they mount on the stock mirrors well.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We used this same brand on a previous truck and were equally satisfied. We used this set for six months until we had to upgrade to a larger truck with factory tow mirrors; they looked new and held their value well at resale.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Mirrors fit just fine. When placing the wedge between the truck mirror ...
customer_reviews.text: Mirrors fit just fine. When placing the wedge between the truck mirror and towing mirror I recommend using a flashlight to peer in the screw hole to make sure the holes are lined up correctly. I didn't care for them because the passenger mirror seemed to magnify the reflection and was distracting. Only other issue was ease of theft with the big knobbed hand screw that holds them on. Returned item (only my second time returning an item and Amazon is awesome with returns)
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Secure and provide clear, steady view.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, very secure and steady. Only complaint is that the mirror is a bit sticky and difficult to adjust. But, once it is adjusted, it stays and gives a solid, steady view. One recommendation I read about these mirrors that I agree with is to thoroughly clean and apply a coat of wax to your vehicle's mirrors to protect them before sliding these on (if you have painted or chrome). Overall, short of spending $700 per mirror to replace my mirrors with towing mirrors, these are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Buckaroo

customer_reviews.title: Great mirrors 110% satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box very easy to put on I had both sides on in less than 10 minutes came with 2 different shims to fit different mirrors cover completely my stock mirrors an doesn't cover my turn singles easy to adjust an look good on my 2004 f-150 going to make backing a towing my 21ft poontoon boat a lots easier
customer_reviews.author: Smithers

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far these have been doing a fine job as tow mirrors. They are easy to install, sliding right over the existing mirror. They are pretty stiff though, so it can be a little difficult to get the exact view that you need. Only thing I do not like about them is that the passenger side mirror seems to be zoomed in a little bit too much... Overall, not bad, they do that job.
customer_reviews.author: B4M5G

customer_reviews.title: Good look when on truck
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on, check out the video on YouTube. Gives you that extra viewing angle when towing. No noise going down the road and no vibrations either. They do look good on the truck so not necessary to remove.
customer_reviews.author: tom s.

customer_reviews.title: Great tow mirrors
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I bought these for my 2013 F-150 which Amazon says it won't fit but it does. They fit snugly and look almost like the factory installed them (if you don't look too closely). I am towing a 30' travel trailer and these really help. Others have commented that the mirrors vibrated a lot. I did not see any and can only assume they didn't install them correctly. My only complaint is that I was sent the wrong instructions with the mirrors but I found the correct ones online.
customer_reviews.author: WhoDat

customer_reviews.title: Fit well and no highway noise.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my 2005 Ford F-150 Super Cab. These fit the vehicle nicely and do not generate noise at highway speeds. I do concur with others in complaining about the adjustment knobs. Not able to tighten easily with my bare hand. Had to use channel locks to get a good torque. I will look to replace the knobs. I do recommend these. Performed well. OOPS!!! SORRY FOLKS I ERRED. THESE DID NOT FIT MY TRUCK. HAD TO RETURN THEM. I HAVE STANDARD MIRRORS ON MY TRUCK. THE ONES THAT HAVE TO BE ADJUSTED BY HAND. AMAZON WAS GREAT DEALING WITH MY RETURN. PURCHASE THE STRAP ON MODEL OF MIRROR WHICH THIS REVIEW IS ABOUT.
customer_reviews.author: Maineac

customer_reviews.title: Worked surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: Had to tow a load about 500 miles in a vehicle without tow mirrors...these worked very well. Only complaint would be that they didn't really fit a 2010 F-150 well.
customer_reviews.author: bajaman

customer_reviews.title: Not this one.
customer_reviews.text: It fit, but the mechanics of the fit were not right. I ended up using some rubber and a bunggees to make it fit to get my new RV home. Still wasn;'t right wobbled and wiggled the whole way and the image was semi useless. I returned them. 2008 Ford F-150 crew cab.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: These mirrors work great and have come in handy often
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. Took a little getting used to. As the passenger I could see the road through the mirror which made me carsick. It just took me changing my habit of looking at the mirror. Does t happen from the drivers side. These mirrors work great and have come in handy often.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gorrell

customer_reviews.title: These tow mirrors fit on my 2007 Ford f150 perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: These tow mirrors fit on my 2007 Ford f150 perfectly! They work WAY better than the strap on kind I use to use. They simply slide on and there is a knob on the back to clamp them in place. They even have cut outs if your mirrors have lights on them. I have not had a chance to actually use them yet going down the road so I do not know how well they hold up to vibration while traveling on the highway but if they have any issues I will be sure to update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: These are great addition when I pull my RV. They are easy to install. The only thing is the mirrors on the outside have very little adjustment. They don’t rattle or vibrate.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Metting

customer_reviews.title: Only sent passenger side mirrors twice!
customer_reviews.text: My husband was very excited to get these mirrors but when he received the package he was disappointed to find two passenger side mirrors. Returned product and ordered replacement... received new package only to find the same issue once more. I don't think it's worth try I for a third time to get this right. Very very disappointed with this product/manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Bene

customer_reviews.title: They install really easily, like 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: finally got a chance to use these mirrors. They install really easily, like 5 minutes. Easy to remove. My only complaint would be that with the way the mirror is molded, I can't fold the entire mirror back, which i would need to do in order to fit in my garage door with the mirrors on.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: $20 cheaper than on retailer.com. Save money and buy here. These are the same product. The look great, it makes it seem like it's part of the truck (OEM).
customer_reviews.author: MKRLAdelman

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy install
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to install and remove. It's amazing something so simple can solve the problem of seeing all of what I'm towing.
customer_reviews.author: kathyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love them they are an amazing price and the work great we have an 08 Ford F-150 and we tow a 21 foot camper and it definitely helps having these on. They are extremely easy to install and take off.
customer_reviews.author: andrea Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good product, Did not fit vehicle it said it would
customer_reviews.text: The product itself seemed to be of good quality. I am giving it three stars because it was mislabeled somewhere along the way with a sticker indicating it would work on a 2013 Ford F150 XLT King Cab but it most definitely does not. The instructions in the box indicated it only works on F150s up to 2009 or 2011 (I don't recall which now). It was nowhere even close to fitting my vehicle. I returned the product and received a refund in a timely fashion.
customer_reviews.author: COmommyX2

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2009 F150 XLT!
customer_reviews.text: It fits like its custom made. This is my second set, the first set lasted about 5 years. I lost the wedges, so when one cracked I replaced the set. $30 is a great price for these mirrors. My Truck is a 2009 F150 XLT. These are the best mirrors you can buy without replacing the OME mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Easy on. Easy off
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. Slid right over my stock mirrors and turn signals. Wide enough to see the back corners of my trailer. Could be a little sturdier so the screw doesn’t make it bow out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice and well made. Happy
customer_reviews.text: These work really well. Great tight fit. I really only need the driver side but good to have both I guess. Great cheap option.
customer_reviews.author: rudelini

customer_reviews.title: Great temporary mirror add-ons for towing a large travel trailer
customer_reviews.text: Fit great, and you can feel confident there's no chance they'll come off or damage your mirrors.. Look a lot better than some of the alternatives. Quick and easy to put on and take off. I had them on my GMC and loved them. These mirrors are bigger then my old ones.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy in San Antonio
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good but... fell off twice . The second time one of them was lost. Extra vision not that better than I have without them. Will be shopping for some better ones.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Toombs

customer_reviews.title: Great for towing safely
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and use product. Take your time adjusting the mirrors and it will pay dividends down the road (no pun intended).i use mine when hauling a 23 foot camper, and then remove when not towing it. Fit my 2010 Ford f-150fx4 perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tom T

customer_reviews.title: Best add on mirrors you can find!!!
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors are fabulous!! They fit like a glove and provide the extra vision I need to pull my fifth wheel. They don't vibrate and are rock solid! I can now see down the sides of the trailer and see where the wheels are when backing into camp sites. And the price was great, beat Camping World (it doesn't take much to do that) and the shipping was free. What a deal!!! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend these mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: TNH2O

customer_reviews.title: Great, but didn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: The ball behind the mirror seized after about a year and no longer allowed the mirror to adjust without breaking. :(
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly fit even though they weren't suppose to!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2008 Ford F150 FX4 that has most every option including the mirrors with the turn signal indicator lamps immediately below the side mirrors. I researched these trailer mirrors and although every formal resource, including the one from Amazon and the manufacturer, said this was not the trailer mirror for my truck, I found one review that said they took a chance and they fit and worked fine. I had the same experience, they worked fine. There are cut-outs that allowed the turn signal lamps to fuction perfectly fine and the shape of the mirror was a perfect fit!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Parent

customer_reviews.title: May be a great product ... if they can get them packaged correctly!
customer_reviews.text: I really want these mirrors, however that does not seem to be in the cards. I have ordered them twice and so far I have four passenger-side mirrors. *BOTH* orders contained two 11801's (passenger) each instead of an 11801 (passenger) and an 11802 (driver). (This is the manufacturer's packaging, not Amazon's, that is incorrect.) However, I did install the first mirror and it fit beautifully and looked like it was part of the truck. It looks like it will be nice and secure. I am just not sure how to get them. Maybe I'll wait a while until the current inventory is depleted and try again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lamerand

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: The mirrors are as adverised, they go on easily and securely. Everything, but the mirror is plastic, so durability could be questioned, although I had a similiar pair from another manufacture that lasted until one of the glass mirrors was broken during a household move (should have had it on the truck instead of in a box). On the old pair I had installed a blindspot mirror as well, because those blindspots still exist even though you can see around the trailer. They do make hauling safer. Be sure you select the correct pair for you vehicle's side mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: critical thinker

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: These are junk you can't adjust them enough to use them I missed the return by one day now I am stuck .
customer_reviews.author: Michael  L

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to your current mirror
customer_reviews.text: We didn't want to spend extra money to install all new mirrors for towing so getting these that just slide onto your current mirror whenever we tow our trailer. They have helped in so many ways and are so glad we have these to help. Not having these mirrors would be a nightmare. They slide on with ease and do no damage.
customer_reviews.author: dkvarble

customer_reviews.title: Works well on my 2014 F-150 with fold away mirrors ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well on my 2014 F-150 with fold away mirrors. I put 2" elec. tape on the back of the stock mirrors to avoid any scratching as well as the pad from the factory. 4 stars because of unknown longevity with ABS.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Good fit to factory F150 mirrors.
customer_reviews.text: It would be nice if it extend out a couple of more inches for 8' wide trailers. It does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil Doss

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: These mirror extensions fit well and look "factory". Gives the extra view needed for pulling a camper.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Robinson

customer_reviews.title: For the $$$ you can't beat these mirrors
customer_reviews.text: Whoever designed these did a terrific job -- they fit like a glove on my 2006 Ford F-150 Super Crew.
customer_reviews.author: Infrequent Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mirrors
customer_reviews.text: These towing mirrors fit my 2010 F-150 perfect. They fit tight and do not vibrate while driving giving a perfect view continuously. Wonderfully economic solution for towing.
customer_reviews.author: Wildwood

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly! Bought several different one and had to return all of them. This one was PERFECT.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Tidwell

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors work fine. If installed correctly no chance of coming loose like I read on a review. A little hard to adjust mirrors. Use both thumbs on edge of mirror to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Gino

customer_reviews.title: These mirrors work with my 2006 F-150 Lariat.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews of this product, I decided to buy this set of mirror extensions. The manufacture said they would not fit my 2006 F-150 Lariat model but they do. One or two other reviews said they would so I decided to take a chance. I’m glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Gentljim

customer_reviews.title: The product is pretty good quality and seems to attach to the stock ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is pretty good quality and seems to attach to the stock mirrors securely but aren't really big enough for my 24' enclocsed car trailer. My trailer is 102" wide and they don't really go out far enough to see the side of the trailer when going down the road. They really need to be taller and wider and extend out farther. I am a retired tractor trailer driver so maybe I'm just too used to those big old west coast mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: Art Marco

customer_reviews.title: Great buy very Happy
customer_reviews.text: They look great and function even better on my 05 f150. No warbling, very sturdy. My only dislike is the plastic divider between the led lights but these can be taken off with a dremil.
customer_reviews.author: Fire Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not for my truck
customer_reviews.text: I mistakenly purchased for my F-150 only to find out it didn’ Fit on my full size truck
customer_reviews.author: Cayce

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Fit
customer_reviews.text: Box marked to fit 2006 Ford F-150 which I have, Do not fit at all, will not fully slide on to factory mirrors about 2" gap exists when installed as far as possible between existing mirror and these and overall width (height) of the mirrors are to big do not wrap around my existing mirrors and fall right off. Then to boot I have to pay $7.90 to ship them back . . . what a scam!!!
customer_reviews.author: craig seip

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly what the were described to be. The fit, form and function are all great. The only thing I could see as an improvement would be to use a metal insert and higher security set screw to prevent theft.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful look and worth every single dollar.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my dad's F150 truck. The look and fit perfectly and keep the factory look of the truck. You can't tell that these are slide overs. The don't move or vibrate when driving down the highway and add a lot more viability. My father is very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mel T.

customer_reviews.title: Really Happy with these
customer_reviews.text: I've only used these once, but holy h e double hockey sticks... pretty awesome man. I used them on my 2014 Ford F150 crew cab to tow my 8 foot wide travel trailer. Works like a champ. Mounts easily. No scratches on mirrors from use. Doesn't vibrate. Good purchase. Update: I've used these a lot now. They are great. No problems. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Vibrates too much
customer_reviews.text: Didn't really add that much to the 2012 F-150 and vibrated a bit more than I would like. Returned it after 1 use.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit
customer_reviews.text: These did not fit my 2017 F150 so I had to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Norrington

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Have used the mirror extensions for the 3rd year, hauling the boat to the coast. Easy on and easy off when we get home. No vibration. They work great to widen you rear view.
customer_reviews.author: Opa

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit F150 XL!
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a great towing mirror set, but amazon didn't do their research. This will not fit 2004 and up F150 XL models. Going to the manufacturers website shows that. It's in bold red print. Not sure how the missed that, and i waited too long to try them to find out they were wrong, so i couldn't even return them. XL owners, we're stuck with universal towing mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: A Holmes

customer_reviews.title: they fit over my original mirrors like a glove without interfering with the original mirror or ...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried different mirror extensions in the past and have to say this was by far the easiest to install and remove after towing. During towing they have no vibration to distort the image, they fit over my original mirrors like a glove without interfering with the original mirror or the turn signal located in the factory mirror housing. Probably one of the biggest benefits was the feeling that they weren't possibly going to fall off while you are on the road. On previous extensions I would add small bungee cords to them to make sure they wouldn't fall off. Would buy again and recommend to anyone needing trailer mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tow mirrors
customer_reviews.text: Fit very snug, which was nice. The screw however was not long enough to clamp on. But round trip of total 7 hrs driving no issues good product
customer_reviews.author: Avdo

customer_reviews.title: Gives extra viewing when towing
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 2011 Ford F150 Great for towing and give that added distance along trailer needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: CIPA 11800 tow mirrors
customer_reviews.text: I bought these "slip on, clamp on tow mirrors for my 2011 Ford F150 for towing my 30' travel trailer. The mirrors were listed as "used" but when I got them, they were in the original box and looked brand new to me. Actually, I don't think they had ever been used to tow with. I'm very happy with them so far, they have saved me alot of money over installing Ford's factory two mirrors. The mirrors also blend in so well with the truck that my wife thought that I had taken off the OEM mirrors and installed new ones. A good product at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: ryeboy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I knew this would not fit the f-150 ford I own but I heated the plastic on the top of the mirror fit great looks like it was made for it
customer_reviews.author: david clark

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: These towing mirrors fit my 2004 F-150 perfectly. They seem very sturdy and allow for factory turn signals on mirrors. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: bruff53

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors go on great and take off very easily
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these mirrors for towing with my 2013 Ford F150
customer_reviews.text: Product was described accurately. Received this product quickly form the vendor and it was packaged such that it could not be damaged. Absolutely love these mirrors for towing with my 2013 Ford F150, I highly recommend this product to anyone that needs to tow a trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only thing we have found which WORKS
customer_reviews.text: We have used FOUR different towing mirrors on two different trucks in the past year. These actually work...although my wife is bothered by the F-150 inset mirror on the truck itself, having the 3rd mirror is unnerving to her, but these are SO much better than the strap on mirror setup you see on other systems. These do fit on 2013 F-150 trucks (just don't get for the STX -- different mirrors).
customer_reviews.author: Ragnar Danneskjöld

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and much more economical than buying original parts ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and much more economical than buying original parts from dealers that would cost well over $400. not including the installation cost.Original parts are way over priced, Dealers rip us off with the parts cost, we must stay away from them....
customer_reviews.author: Leonard  Guilbault

customer_reviews.title: 2007 F150 Mirror Extensions
customer_reviews.text: Great product and fits perfectly with no vibration when driving. Lets you see behind RV your pulling. Was a little concerned when the package arrived becasue the box cover did not include 2007 as web did but it does fit a 2007 F150 Super Crewcab. This is my third set of extension mirrors I have used over the last 18 years and 3 vehicles. Only drawback is you have to keep from misplacing the wedges. It would be nice if they attached to the mirrors when not in use so they could be kept together.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Great For Hauling
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Needed these for my '06 F-150 hauling a 26ft camper. Helped A TON! Was really nice to be able to see behind/beside the camper to know when it was safe to pass and merge lanes.
customer_reviews.author: KalEl28

customer_reviews.title: Geat idea and product
customer_reviews.text: Fit the factory mirrors perfectly on my 2008 Ford F-150 and extended them for rowing a wide trailer without having to spend $400.00 plus buying original factory extended mirrors. Does the same job for a fraction of the price. can easily be removed when not towing a vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: MacDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Quick solution
customer_reviews.text: Nice alternative to putting giant mirrors on my truck full time. Install quickly and easily. The hardest part is adjusting the mirror to get the right angle for what I'm trying to see. Takes my wife and I 5 minutes of "now a little bit higher, now lower".
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Glidden

customer_reviews.title: Got the shipment. It had 2 right side mirrors ...
customer_reviews.text: Got the shipment. It had 2 right side mirrors and no left side mirror. Returned and the second shipment was exactly the same! No left side mirror! Very frustrated. Now I am with out and needed them very badly to pick up my new RV.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT FORD

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors are better than I expected. I am always hesitant when it comes to inexpensive bolt-on's but these are quite nice. Typically I buy things for my truck that are a good balance of function and form with a willingness to pay more for better quality. I took a chance on these and it payed off. They offer good visibility of any trailer that I have towed and they look decent on the truck (not too much like an afterthought).
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors are an EXACT fit for my 2005 F150 FX4 Supercrew. The pop right on, screw on tight. Take the manufacturer's suggestion and apply a coat of wax or armourall (sp?) prior to using - this will reduce friction and possible scratching of OEM mirrors. The additional mirror adjusts in all directions and has a bigger than anticipated surface area. I'm pulling a 23' Shamrock TT, but image they would work with a 33' or better.
customer_reviews.author: Gregger88

customer_reviews.title: Drivers side works great.
customer_reviews.text: Passenger side mirror still not out far enough from truck. The mirror has a little to much zoom. Drivers side works great.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Brozak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Was errie on purchasing the extenders only because of the low price compared to other sites. We are very pleased with the quality and ease of use. However, the very 1st time we tried to adjust the mirrors we were fearful that they would break. They were very tight at first, now we can adjust with ease for different driver heights. We highly recommend these. $ well spent!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They do to, FIT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these mirrors for our 2008, Ford F150 pickup. According to Amazon's "make sure it fits", they would not fit. However; the manufacturers website had recommended this model number for our pickup. They actually fit perfectly. The factory mirrors on our pickup have the LED turning indicators at the bottom. The mirrors fit securely with very little vibration. Our drive was down highway for several miles and then 5 miles of washboard road. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Cielo Di Bend

customer_reviews.title: Had these same brand (different model) on an older Ford and they worked fine so I decided to buy a pair for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 2012 Ford F-150. Had these same brand (different model) on an older Ford and they worked fine so I decided to buy a pair for the newer truck. I went about 6,000 miles with the old ones and never had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Easy on and off! Great for the price used on our F150 towing a 34 foot travel trailer!
customer_reviews.author: DesignScapes

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MIRRORS
customer_reviews.text: THESE EXTENSIONS WORK GREAT. they vastly improve visibility when towing my boat . they secure solidly to mirrors and look like they came from the factory. excellent price would recomend to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The mirrors worked great.. added just enough to get a view ...
customer_reviews.text: The mirrors worked great .. added just enough to get a view of traffic coming up behind. I gave it 4 stars because the molding did not exactly fit the mirror on my 2013 F150.. but close enough to stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Standing on the corner

customer_reviews.title: 2004- F150 Lariat - Works great
customer_reviews.text: So the product takes about a minute to install and a minute or two each mirror to adjust. Wait until your trailer is attached before attempting to adjust mirrors. Installation was super simple and the instructions were great.
customer_reviews.author: Anne H.

customer_reviews.title: Love these mirrors!
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't be more pleased with these mirrors! They fit our Ford F150 perfectly and make it so much nicer and safer to be able to see on the sides of our travel trailer. Absolutely no rattle or noise on the road. Easy to put on and take off. They are exactly what we needed and at a price we could afford.
customer_reviews.author: B. Messmer

customer_reviews.title: Flew off our truck
customer_reviews.text: Good visibility however we thought it was attached properly and one flew off (pulling our trailer) in the freeway. We were lucky it didn’t hit anyone’s windshield or cause an accident.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent when pulling a trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Used these on my 2013 F150 (Lariat with the chrome package). Pulled a trailer to Alaska and back and couldn't have done it without them. Really worked well. They came loose early on in the trip but once tightened a second time, they were solid for the rest of the trip. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Hjul

customer_reviews.title: CIPA 11800 Ford F-150 Custom Towing Mirror - Pair
customer_reviews.text: Towing a big trailer, cannot see as well behind as with some gargantuan factory mirrors. These install in a minute, fit perfectly, and increase my field of view to the rear. It does take a bit of getting used to using 2 mirrors per side with their disparate views, but makes me (more) legal, and I can take them off in a minute when not towing. Cheapest price around, free shipping, no tax. What is not to like/
customer_reviews.author: BART 882

customer_reviews.title: Good addition for towing.
customer_reviews.text: Gives that little extra view down the side of our trailer. Easy to install when needed and remove when not.
customer_reviews.author: el_campede

customer_reviews.title: Grrrrrrrrrrreat!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great price for tow mirrors! Simply slide over mirrors and secure! Works great for hauling my camper so I can safely see behind me!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 2006 F150. Perfect fit. These really provide a good view alongside my 25ft travel trailer. I can actually see behind my trailer, at least through the driver's side. Very little shake, even at highway speeds. Good construction and mirrors appear to be very stiff and stay in place once adjusted. An inexpensive choice for the occasional towing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Boggs

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Easy install doesn't show in picture but has big plastic wing nuts for install that aren't very sightly. Easy on and off and look better than the alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Huff

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The mirrors performed well on my only opportunity to use them. I rated them down one point due to the fact that the right hand mirror will not stay adjusted, it seems to vibrate downward and outward--a minor problem IF I remember to readjust each time I stop. Also, I had to drill holes in the bottom to allow the courtesy light on the bottom of the mirror to be functional. I would suggest that CIPA could do that and it would not be a problem for vehicles not equipped with the courtesy lights. Aside from these two problems, they are easy to install and remove, and improve rearward visibility when towing a travel trailer tremendously. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly B. Smyth

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you have chrome mirror caps.
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made and right side fits with some extra effort. Drivers side does not fit because the wedge cannot be pushed in far enough. They will not fit because of the factory chrome mirror caps. Manufacture can fix this with minor redesign of the wedge.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Wold

customer_reviews.title: Safety First!  Great item!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and remove. Great fit. Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: R. Rupp

product_meta.title: CIPA 11800 Ford F-150 Custom Towing Mirror - Pair
product_meta.description:
Style:PairCIPA's Custom Towing Mirrors were designed to fit over standard factory rearview side mirrors, and are available in over 40 exclusive applications to fit a variety of popular truck and SUV models. The CIPA Custom Towing Mirror is durable, aerodynamic, and sleeve fitted to your vehicles specifications. These mirrors will slide snugly over your vehicles existing rearview side mirror, and features an additional adjustable mirror on the outboard end that extends your towing vision, without obstructing your existing vehicle mirror. No tools are required, and no marks or holes are left on your vehicle. The CIPA Towing Mirrors and installation knobs are made with durable ABS plastic known for its strength, rigidity, and unbreakable security. The mirror face is made with scratch-resistant glass for years of unobstructed towing use. The installation hooks are formed from a polypropylene plastic that has excellent long-term shape conformity, and provides years of installation reliability. CIPA Custom Towing Mirrors can withstand the elements to provide increased all-weather Towing Vision capability. This kit includes 1 driver side mirror, 1 passenger side mirror, 4 installation knobs, 2 left hand installation wedges, 2 right hand installation wedges, 4 felt strips, and illustrated installation instructions. Not all hardware will be required during installation. Please refer to the instructions for information on what pieces your vehicle will require. Note: These mirrors will NOT fit over STX style or Super Duty mirrors. Expand your Horizons

AMAZON.COM



 CIPA Custom Towing Mirrors are the optimal way for drivers to efficiently and inexpensively increase their visibility on the road during towing situations by increasing the effectiveness of their vehicle's two existing OEM side, rearview mirrors. Sold as a pair and available in a large number of exclusive applications designed to fit a variety of popular truck and SUV models, these mirrors' slip-on design over existing mirrors and secure wedge-lock and threaded knob mechanism ensure quick and easy tool-free installation suitable for recreational and commercial use of all levels. 



Easy, effective augmentation of OEM side rearview mirrors.
View larger. 



Dramatically improve your rear field of view.
View larger. 



Secure wedge-lock design.
View larger. 

INCREASE REAR VISIBILITY WHEN TOWING
 Towing incidents involving loads wider than your pulling vehicle are common in work and moving scenarios, as well as during recreational activities like trailer-based camping and the hauling of off-road vehicles and watercraft. Regardless of when these events occur the common problem is that they can create significant and potentially dangerous challenges to drivers' rear field of view. For over 20 years CIPA Custom Tow Mirrors have provided the optimal solution to deal with this problem quickly, effectively and inexpensively, no matter the make and model of your vehicle. Augmenting your vehicle's standard OEM rearview mirrors CIPA Custom Tow Mirrors are aerodynamic, sliding snugly over your vehicle's existing rearview side mirror and feature an additional mirror on the outboard end that can be independently adjusted. The result is a new and improved rearview mirror assembly that extends your towing vision, without obstructing your existing vehicle mirror. 

DURABLE CONSTRUCTION AND EASY INSTALLATION
 CIPA Custom Tow Mirrors are made from durable ABS plastic, with the additional outer mirror built into each, constructed of scratch-resistant glass. This rugged construction ensures years of unobstructed towing use that can be counted on in the most demanding of situations. Mirror installation is tool-free and when done correctly and carefully poses no risk of scratching to your vehicle. CIPA Custom Tow Mirrors attach to your vehicle's existing side rearview mirrors using a secure wedge-lock design. Once the Custom Tow Mirror's main section is slid over your vehicle's OEM rearview mirror, the high-strength plastic wedge included for each mirror is placed between them. The wedge is in turn held in place with a threaded knob that passes through the towing mirror to press the wedge against the original mirror with the end of the wedge holding the towing mirror firmly in place. In addition, included neoprene tape pieces are placed on the wedge and also inside of the towing mirror during the first installation. This tape acts as a cushion that protects the vehicle mirror from scratches and damage that could inadvertently be caused during installation of the towing mirror. Together this makes CIPA Custom Tow Mirrors extremely easy to install in seconds by virtually any driver, of any level of experience and the perfect midline priced solution for all your towing needs. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX*
 * 2 – CIPA Custom Towing Mirrors (driver's side and passenger side)
 * 2 – Installation wedges (driver's side and passenger side)
 * 2 – Long strips of neoprene tape (for inside of mirror)
 * 2 – Short strips of neoprene tape (for wedge)
 * 1 – Illustrated instruction sheet

ONE-YEAR LIMITED WARRANTY
 CIPA products are warranted to be free from defect in material and workmanship for one year. Any material shown to the satisfaction of CIPA to be defective at the time of shipment will be replaced without charge or CIPA may, at its option, render a credit in such amounts as CIPA deems reasonable, provided however, that in no event shall CIPA be responsible for claims beyond the replacement value of any defective material or in any way liable or responsible for damages of any nature whatsoever which may result from the use of its products. 

ABOUT CIPA
 Since 1985, CIPA-USA has been a privately held US Corporation operating in Port Huron, Michigan. CIPA has continued to show healthy growth year after year and currently manufactures its products in the US, Asia and France and continues to provide high quality, fast-moving products setting sales volume records in almost every category sold. 

* Components may vary with each application.
feature_bullets: Slides over existing mirror with wedge lock security
Custom design ensures a perfect fit, and no annoying vibration
Easy installation with no tools required;Does not obstruct existing mirror
Sleek custom design compliments the existing mirror
Does not fit 2WD XL, STX-style or Lariat

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,107 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
